member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapper
member.summary: Provides color remapping of animation states

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapper.OriginalHue
member.summary: The source hue value that shall be remapped

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapper.Remap(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationFrame,BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationFrame,BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.ColorRemapInfo)
member.summary: Remaps all pixels in the specified sequence state's frame that have a hue value of OriginalHue Â± 45 (and a lightness less than 340) to the new values specified by changes
member.param: the animation frame is frame is to be remapped
The animation frame in which the new information should be saved
a ColorRemapInfo specifying the destination color range
member.remarks: This is an O(width*height) operation - and pixel operations are slow! Note that this will also loop through the whole image if changes specifies no remap is to be done. This should be prevented by the caller. Also note that the original frame will be overwritten TODO: this should instead create a new, remapped copy of the frame, so that copying as an extra operation is not required beforehand

member.summary: A helper function for Remap that converts a Color to its 16 bit representation

member.summary: Initialize a new LoadSpritesEventArgs object

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Participant
member.summary: Represents a participant in a game

remarks.para: This class represents a participant, which can in turn be able to control zero (spectator) or more BombDudes (players) in the game.
In a server-based network game, each client is a participant from the server's perspective, while each client sees only itself and the server as participants.
In a peer to peer game, each client sees itself and every other client as a participant
Important: The results of a public method call, as well as every event must be idempotent!

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Participant.HasAuthority
member.summary: Is the participant authorized to make changes to the board other than its own dudes' actions? This applies to the server normally, or to everyone in peer-to-peer games

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Participant.StartNegotiation
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is called to notify the participant that game negotiation begins
member.remarks: After receiving this, the participant should raise the Negotiate event to state its preferences. This can be done from inside the method, if possible.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Participant.StartRound(BomberStuff.Core.Player[])
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, is called to notify the participant that the game round starts
member.param: the players that the participant owns
member.remarks: Receiving this means negotiation is complete, subsequent Negotiate events will be ignored.

member.name: E:BomberStuff.Core.Participant.Negotiate
member.summary: Signals the preferences of the participant during negotiation phase
member.remarks: This should be raised (once) between receiving the StartNegotiation and StartRound notifications

member.name: E:BomberStuff.Core.Participant.ControlPlayer
member.summary: Signales that the specified player (owned by the participant, unless the participant has authority) is changing its movement

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.NegotiateEventArgs.NumberOfOwnPlayers
member.summary: number of players that the participant would like to control

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.ControlPlayerEventArgs.PlayerIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the player being controlled

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.ControlPlayerEventArgs.Direction
member.summary: Specifies the player's direction

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.ControlPlayerEventArgs.Moving
member.summary: Specifies whether the player is moving

member.name: T:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder
member.summary: A wrapper object providing functionality for creating raw bitmap data from different image formats

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.BitmapHeaderSize
member.summary: The size of a bitmap file header

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.PaletteSize
member.summary: The size of the bitmap's palette

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.PaletteLocation
member.summary: The index into the BitmapData array at which the palette starts, if present

member.name: F:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.DataLocation
member.summary: The index into the BitmapData array at which the image data starts

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.#ctor(BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder)
member.summary: Copy constructor. Performs a shallow copy, and creates a new, blank array of previous size in BitmapData

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Constructor that creates the byte array required to hold a bitmap file with the specified properties and initializes the bitmap header information
member.param: Number of bits per pixel in the bitmap.
The width of the bitmap image
The height of the bitmap image
member.remarks: Bitmap images support values of 1, 4, 8, 16, 24 or 32. Images with less than 16 bits per pixel will need a palette of 2^bpp 32-bit entries, which is allocated by the constructor.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.GetStream
member.summary: Creates a new backed by the BuildmapBuilder's bitmap data
member.returns: a Stream that will provide bitmap data
member.remarks: This method's return value is primarily intended for use with or similar (for example Texture creation) functions

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromBitmap(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a bitmap-format palette from the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the Stream to read the palette from
member.remarks: This will read a constant amount of bytes. The caller needs to make sure that this amount of data is available.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromPCX(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a PCX-format palette from the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the Stream to read the palette from
member.remarks: TODO: This will read a currently unknown number of bytes.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadPaletteFromPCX(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads a PCX-format palette from a Stream with the help of the specified and inserts it into the bitmap data
member.param: the BinaryReader to read the palette with
member.remarks: TODO: This will read a currently unknown number of bytes.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.ReadDataFromAni(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Reads the actual image data from a Stream with the help of the specified and insert it into the bitmap data
member.param: the BinaryReader to read the data with
the maximum number of bytes to be read from the stream. Pass if there is no limit
member.returns: A positive number of bytes read from the stream if successful, the negative of the number of bytes read on failure, zero if no bytes have been read.
member.remarks: The data will be read using the Run-length-encoding format used in Atomic bomberman ANI files, which is (exactly?) the same as that used in TGA files.

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes of the object's unmanaged and optionally managed resources
member.param: true to free managed resources

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the object's managed and unmanaged resources

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer. Disposes of unmanaged resources

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Width
member.summary: Width of the bitmap

member.name: P:BomberStuff.Core.Utilities.BitmapBuilder.Height
member.summary: Height of the bitmap

a BinaryReader for s
current position in the file

item length

item end position

member.name: M:BomberStuff.Files.AniFileReader.AddSequence(BomberStuff.Core.Animation.AnimationList,System.String,BomberStuff.Core.Animation.Animation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a Sequence with the specified name
member.param: animtion list to add the animation to
A String containing the name of the sequence
The Sequence to be added
Display additional information on the console?
member.remarks: The sequence name is checked against a list of known animations. Unknown sequences will be ignored.
